title: Drawing, "Design for a Soup Tureen", March 1941
medium: Pen and black ink, green color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, upper right: 67
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, lower center: SOUPIERE; in graphite: A; in black ink: LONGUEUR; 36 cms/HAUTEUR TOTALE: 24 cms; lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/3.14; to right of lid handle: [arrow pointing left] onyx; to right of cover: [arrow pointing left downward] OVERTURE
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Bulbous shaped tureen drawn in elevation with a rounded lid surmounted by two arched handles, indicated in green color pencil to be executed in onyx (see plan) flanked by thin rectangular handles each with two cut-out fingerholes (see plan) raised in a circular reeded base with a central applied molding ending in a molded foot rim. Underdrawing in graphite of tureen in golden section.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Soup Tureen", March 1941.
March 1941. Pen and black ink, green color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper. Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra. 1995-164-41.
